intro: Sherardia pantocsekii, commonly known as the Ethiopian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
